title: Islamic Golden Age and Scientific Achievements

vocab.definition: A period of great learning and achievement in the Islamic world from 8th-13th centuries
A building where Muslims gather for worship and prayer
The political and religious leader of the Islamic community
A branch of mathematics developed by Islamic scholars
A famous library and research center in Baghdad during the Islamic Golden Age

teachingNotes: Emphasize Islamic contributions to science, mathematics, and medicine. Discuss how Islamic scholars preserved Greek and Roman knowledge. Show the geographic spread of Islamic civilization.

sample.question: What period of great Islamic learning lasted from the 8th-13th centuries?

truefalse.question: Islamic scholars developed the branch of mathematics called algebra.

multiplechoice.question: What was the famous library and research center in Baghdad called?

shortanswer.question: What are two contributions Islamic scholars made to learning?
